documents.document: @pacodylan and a bow tie that goes with the dog? (Please tell me you're bringing this important accessory)
@FitKiwi exactly. The review recommendations outline some ways they're working on it. I can only hope it's big change
@pacodylan I hope it's not too late to pick out some decorative umbrellas for your photo shoot...
@FitKiwi yeah that's the bit I'm wary of. I asked DHB about some specifics even without naming names and they invoked employee privacy
@henrycooke @DomPost might have to check out the west coast beaches along the train line!
@FitKiwi they can be flagged by coroners/HDC - but I think it would be hard to pin anything on any 1 person where there's systemic problems
@JohnnyRedLives @Jess_McAllen I know right. From chatting to nurses I gather the fax system might be being phased out but not 100% sure
@henrycooke I think they both still count as in the harbour? I'm off shift now I hope the @DomPost investigates where I can swim this wknd
So we've had no summer. But forecast for the next 2 days is looking good. And it's a long weekend. What did Welling… https://t.co/pUbvYdf4sG
@Jess_McAllen thanks Jess. It's quite an illuminating case isn't it
@Incrediblehug @Jess_McAllen there's only about 30 acute beds at Wellington Hospital. It's just mind boggling
@tomdom76 what? You do know I rushed out the door for breaking news and am still there...
@katieabradford according to my sources and OIA's last March yes it was a factor. Bed pressures mentioned in review… https://t.co/BpNXOaTdJ2
@hautanagirl and only two full time psychs for a capital city's hospital... don't you worry Emma I have OIAs in with every DHB about this
@hautanagirl it's strongly evident from the review just how stretched and overbooked they are! Yet the DHB never admits to this publicly.

@chris_wikaira my friends get weirded out when they hear me use their names making group bookings on the ph. I'm like - trust me it's easier
@IsobelEwing Indigo! They need to get their ears checked
@purcellpw yes! I did get that when I lived there. And in QLD no one ever mistook it because they pronounced Tania "Tannya"
@BlackTulipJu I've read interesting pieces before about why certain kids' names suddenly become popular. Might've been in a Gladwell book
@BlackTulipJu my mum has one of those names that people who have known her for years just deliberately mispronounce because it's easier
@purcellpw think it's becoming more popular outside of Israel/Russia. I have many distant cousins called Talia too apparently. And Naphtali
A day in the life of someone with a weird name: "Name please?" "Talia" "Tania?" "Ta-LI-a" "Oh NATALIA!" "Yeah sure" .. "Latte for Letalia?"
@reckonsemoji @NZStuff "News Ealand"! I love that, definitely stealing.
@Iainmcgregor3 @NZStuff so true. I got this alert while watching CNN...
@PatrickCrewdson @NZStuff so it was you 👏 👏 11/10
This is the best @NZStuff push alert since the one where the lost Kiwi dude was found on a beach in Thailand playin… https://t.co/HisXdLNeIT

A @MetService forecaster told me 2 days ago Welly would get sun today & I should plan a beach trip. I was like I'll… https://t.co/lYc9aEac1u
@TommyLivingston well this one said she lived in Taupo. Although she also claimed to speak 8 languages and hail from San Fran. So who knows
Interesting insight. https://t.co/gY9OV4UgMQ
@Dovil @BillyRalston I wanted to say, "well this is my country too and I'd like you to leave" but probs not best idea on the Dom tips line
@BillyRalston @Dovil sounds like it. She led with: "I've lived in New Zealand for 28 years so it's my country now too"...
@MattNippert well if I ever decide to do one of those stories where we track down hiding nazi war criminals I think I know who to call
@kristinhallNZ @paulbrislen not yet! She did tell me she had a word to customs about immigrants last time she was at the airport though...
@paulbrislen I was very polite about it of course. The newsroom will attest a few choice swear words emerged once I hung up
@kristinhallNZ @paulbrislen she's called the newsroom before. I didn't have the spare time to query her last time...
@paulbrislen sounded old. She asked how she could get a letter published in the paper and I said try leaving out the racism and hate speech
@kristinhallNZ @paulbrislen she said she was from the US but had a Euro accent. Guess she probably couldn't tell over the ph that I'm Jewish
A lady rang the newsroom to say Muslims, Chinese are ruining NZ. I asked where she was from. Her:"Honey, I've got blonde hair and blue eyes"
@TheHowe this is performance art of the highest order. It needs to be preserved and displayed in Te Manawa forever
